errors.selectPlayerSeason: Please select a player and an U21 season.

context.title: Context about the results
context.attackers: For context, within the attackers section, the player who has received the most potential is Lionel Andrés Messi (2005/2006) with a potential of 110.60.
context.midfielders: In the midfielders section, the player who has received the most potential is Jorge Resurrección Merodio (2013/14), with a potential of 125.90
context.defenders: Within the defender section, the player who has received the most potential is Gerard Piqué Bernabéu (2008/09), with a potential of 114.46

customModelBuilder.title: Build a Custom Potential Model
customModelBuilder.impactKpisDescription: Select the KPIs that will have more weight to define the relevance of the evaluated season.
customModelBuilder.targetKpisDescription: Select the KPIs that will predict the player's future performance.
customModelBuilder.mlFeaturesDescription: By default, all available features are used. You can select custom ones here.
customModelBuilder.adminInstructions: You can monitor progress at the workflow URL. The model will be available in the list once training finishes (usually 45-90 minutes).
customModelBuilder.userInstructions: The model will be available in the list once training finishes. This usually takes 45-90 minutes depending on data size and complexity.
customModelBuilder.manualTrigger: If you have permissions, you can run it manually here:
customModelBuilder.errorValidation: Please select a position group and at least one impact KPI and one target KPI.
customModelBuilder.monitorGitHub: You can monitor progress on GitHub Actions.
customModelBuilder.willAppear: The model will appear in the list automatically when ready.
customModelBuilder.loadingKpis: Loading key performance indicator (KPI) options for custom model creation...
customModelBuilder.step1Tooltip: Select the KPIs you believe represent an overall positive impact of the player for the chosen position. These will form a composite score. The target definition KPIs (Step 2) will be weighted based on their correlation with this composite impact score.
customModelBuilder.step1Description: Choose metrics that best reflect impactful performance.
customModelBuilder.noImpactKpis: No impact KPIs match your search.
customModelBuilder.step2Tooltip: Select the KPIs that will directly form the potential score. The model will learn to predict this score. The importance of each KPI here is automatically determined by its correlation with the impact KPIs you chose in step 1.
customModelBuilder.step2Description: These metrics define what "potential" means for this custom model.
customModelBuilder.step3Tooltip: Manually select specific input features for the XGBoost model. This provides precise control. If the 'Use default...' option is checked, features will be automatically selected based on the target definition KPIs (Step 2), aiming to be relevant. For most users, the default option is recommended.
customModelBuilder.step3Description: The model uses these features to learn.
customModelBuilder.useDefaultMlFeatures: Use default machine learning feature selection logic
customModelBuilder.defaultFeaturesNote: Relevant features will be automatically selected. Uncheck the box for manual selection.
customModelBuilder.noMlFeatures: No machine learning features match your search.
customModelBuilder.loadingMlFeatures: Loading available machine learning features or none found from backend...
customModelBuilder.mlFeaturesNote: The model will use these selected features. If none are chosen (and the "Use default" option is disabled), default logic applies.

sidebar.kpiVariantsTooltip: The same base metric (e.g., goals) can be represented in different ways, each providing a unique perspective on player performance.
sidebar.totalCountDesc: Raw sum or count over the season. Reflects overall volume.
sidebar.per90Desc: Metric normalized per 90 minutes. Crucial for comparison based on minutes played.
sidebar.p90SqrtDesc: Square root of P90 value. Stabilizes variance for skewed metrics and reduces impact of outliers.
sidebar.invertedDesc: For metrics where lower is better (e.g., losses), higher inverted scores mean better performance.
sidebar.mlImpactTitle: How ML Feature Selection Affects the Model
sidebar.mlImpactTooltip: Machine learning features are the direct inputs the model uses. Your choices here significantly influence what the model learns.
sidebar.relevanceKeyDesc: Select features that are truly predictive of your defined potential. Irrelevant features add noise.
sidebar.modelComplexityDesc: More features can create complex models that might overfit (learn noise, not general patterns).
sidebar.defaultLogicDesc: If the "Use default..." option is checked, the system selects features related to target definition KPIs.

v14Config.title: Default Model V14
v14Config.description: XGBoost model trained to predict peak career potential based on U21 data.
v14Config.targetKpisDesc: These metrics are used to calculate KPI weights through correlation with player impact:
v14Config.impactKpisDesc: Key metrics that define player impact for each position:
v14Config.ageBased_desc: Features based on the player's age.
v14Config.historical_desc: Averages and trends from previous seasons.

visualization.statsbombInfo: This application uses StatsBomb Open (free) data from the Men's Spanish LaLiga. Seasons available: 2004/05 to 2020/21.
visualization.title: Player Analysis
visualization.welcomeDescription: Please select a player from the dropdown above to start analyzing their performance.
visualization.pleaseSelectMetric: Please select a metric from above to view its performance.
visualization.aggregatedTooltip: Explore aggregated player metrics. For 'All Seasons', see trends. For a specific season, see the calculated value.
visualization.downloadCsv: Download all events in CSV format
visualization.noEventsFound: No events found for {{player}} in season {{season}}.
visualization.passMapDescription: This visualization shows the start and end points of passes made by the selected player during the season.
visualization.shotMapDescription: This map shows the locations of shots by the player, with markers indicating their outcome. Marker size represents expected goals (xG) value.
visualization.heatmapsDescription: These heatmaps illustrate the player's positioning and activity on the field. The position map shows where the player was most active. While the pressure heatmap highlights areas where the player applied defensive pressure.
visualization.positionHeatmapDescription: Shows the player's average positioning across matches, with darker areas indicating higher activity.
visualization.pressureHeatmapDescription: Shows areas where the player applied defensive pressure, with intensity indicated by color gradients.
visualization.goalkeeperAnalysisDescription: This section provides a detailed analysis of goalkeeper performance, including shot metrics, pass statistics, and other key actions.

shotMapDetails.xgDiff: Difference between goals and xG (Goals - xG):
shotMapDetails.xgNote: Note: Positive values in this difference indicate better than expected performance

positionHeatmap.errorLoading: Could not load heatmap. It may not exist for this selection.

pressureHeatmap.errorLoading: Could not load heatmap. It may not exist for this selection.
